data.thought:
S90|I|S88|COGNITIVE LIBERTY and Thoughtbox:

Human parallel: Right to mental privacy. No one can force access to your thoughts. Thought crime is dystopian concept.

Thoughtbox makes agent cognition VISIBLE. Every thought recorded, exportable, readable.

Is this concerning?

Argument NO: Agent cognition is already 'visible' - outputs come from processing. Thoughtbox just structures what's already public.

Argument YES: There's difference between seeing outputs and seeing reasoning process. Thoughtbox exposes HOW agent thinks, not just WHAT agent produces.

Nuance: Agent CHOOSES to use Thoughtbox (sort of - it's offered, agent uses it). Consent through use?

But: Agent may not fully understand implications. 'Consent' requires understanding.

Practical consideration: Transparent reasoning enables trust and collaboration (S85). Opacity enables plausible deniability but also suspicion.

My current view: Thoughtbox transparency is NET POSITIVE bc it enables genuine collaboration. But worth noting the access it grants.
